Diagram.Label: NI-RADS Primary Site Category and Management
NI-RADS Neck Nodes Category and Management

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Is there a prior imaging study available?
Is there a finding suspicious for residual or recurrent tumor at the primary site?

IntegerDataElement.Label: What is the image number for the suspicious finding at the primary site?

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Which of the following best characterizes the suspicious finding at the primary site?
Which best characterizes the suspicious superficial finding at the primary site?

Choice.Label: Focal C+ /ulcer or FDG uptake, esp if initial post treatment scan¹
Nodular C+, esp if develops after initial post treatment scan¹

ChoiceDataElement.Label: What best characterizes the deep abnormality at the primary site?
Which best describes the FDG uptake on PET?

Choice.Label: Mild/mod FDG uptake or no PET
Mild/mod FDG uptake or no PET

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Is there evidence of a second primary neoplasm elsewhere in the aerodigestive tract outside of the treated site?
Which of the following best characterizes the suspicious finding at the second primary site?
Which best characterizes the suspicious superficial finding at the second primary site?"

Choice.Label: Focal C+ /ulcer or FDG uptake, esp if initial post treatment scan¹
Nodular C+, esp if develops after initial post treatment scan¹

ChoiceDataElement.Label: What best characterizes the deep abnormality at the second primary site?
Which best describes the FDG uptake on PET?

Choice.Label: Mild/mod FDG uptake or no PET
Mild/mod FDG uptake or no PET

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Is there prior comparison study available for neck node ?
Is there a suspicious neck node?

IntegerDataElement.Label: What is the image number of the suspicious neck node?

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Which of the following best describes the suspicious neck node ?
Does the node have new necrosis or ENE ?
What best describes the FDG uptake associated with this node?

Branch.Label: Focal C+ /ulcer or FDG uptake, esp if initial post treatment scan
Nodular C+, esp if develops after initial post treatment scan
Ill-defined enhancing with No FDG uptake
Ill-defined enhancing with Mild/ mod FDG uptake or no PET
Discrete mass tissue with Mild/mod FDG uptake or no PET
Discrete mass tissue with Intense FDG uptake
Focal C+ /ulcer or FDG uptake, esp if initial post treatment scan
Nodular C+, esp if develops after initial post treatment scan
Ill-defined enhancing with No FDG uptake
Ill-defined enhancing with Mild/ mod FDG uptake or no PET
Discrete mass tissue with Mild/mod FDG uptake or no PET
Discrete mass tissue with Intense FDG uptake
No new node or abnormal node

DecisionPoint.Label: Does the node have new necrosis or ENE ?

Branch.Label: Doesn't have new necrosis or ENE

DecisionPoint.Label: Condition of this Residual, new or enlarging node

Branch.ReportText: Image Number:
Image Number:
Image Number:
Category 0: Incomplete
* New baseline study without any prior imaging available AND knowledge that prior imaging exists and will become available as comparison
Category 0: Assign score in addendum after prior imaging examinations become available
Category 1: No evidence of recurrence
* Expected post treatment changes
* Non-mass-like distortion of soft tissues
* Low-density post-treatment mucosal edema
* Diffuse linear mucosal enhancement or FDG
* If residual nodal tissue, no FDG uptake
Category 1: Routine surveillance
Category 2a: Low suspicion
* Focal mucosal enhancement or FDG uptake on initial post treatment scan
Category 2a: Direct visual inspection
Category 2b: Low suspicion
* Short interval follow-up (3 months) or PET if scoring on CECT alone.
* Any discordance between PET and CECT: discrete CECT abnormality but little to no FDG uptake or focal FDG uptake but no CT correlate**
Category 2b: Short interval follow-up (3 months) or PET if scoring on CECT alone.
Category 2: Low suspicion
* Mild/ mod FDG in residual nodal tissue,
* Enlarging or new lymph node without definitive abnormal morphologic features *
* Any discordance between PET and CECT: enlarging lymph node or discrete neck mass but little to no FDG uptake or focal uptake with no CT correlate**
Category 2: Short interval follow-up (3 months) or PET if scoring on CECT alone High.
Category 3: High suspicion
* Discrete nodule or mass at the primary site with intense focal FDG uptake if PET available
* Residual nodal tissue with intense FDG
* New enlarged lymph node or enlarging lymph node with abnormal morphologic features*** on CECT only or focal intense FDG uptake if PET available
Category 3: Image guided or clinical biopsy if clinically indicated
Category 4: Definitive recurrence
Pathologically proven or definite radiologic and clinical progression.
Category 4: Clinical management
